title: duplicate endpoints break hot reload
body:
### Describe the bug

I started dev mode today with an error in my endpoints - I defined on multiple times with the same path and method.

This caused a nice exception to be thrown on initial dev mode startup.
After fixing this situation, I forced a reload by pressing "s" in the terminal.

However I now get the exception from below.

I now have to stop and start quarkus again to get going.

### Expected behavior

hot reload just works

### Actual behavior

```

```

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: 
[duplicate-endpoint.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/12343198/duplicate-endpoint.zip)


1. mvn clean compile quarkus:dev
2. Nice error logged informing about the duplicate endpoints
3. Remove GreetingResource#hello2
4. Press s in terminal
5. Exception from above is printed, no way to continue

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

MINGW64_NT-10.0-19045 NANBCHL9NG3 3.3.6-341.x86_64 2022-09-05 20:28 UTC x86_64 Msys

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk 17.0.4 2022-07-19 OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.4+8 (build 17.0.4+8) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.4+8 (build 17.0.4+8, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.2.4.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.4 (9b656c72d54e5bacbed989b64718c159fe39b537) Maven home: C:\eclipse\tools\java\maven Java version: 17.0.4, vendor: Eclipse Adoptium, runtime: C:\eclipse\tools\java\17 Default locale: de_DE, platform encoding: Cp1252 OS name: "windows 10", version: "10.0", arch: "amd64", family: "windows"

### Additional information

_No response_
